channel.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India
channel.description: TOI delivers the Top Latest World news and Headlines from US, UK, Gulf, Pakistan, China, Europe and rest of the world.

image.title: World News, News of World, Top World News, World Breaking Headlines - Times of India

item.title: Death toll at Nigeria church building collapse rises to 45
item.description: Rescue workers have pulled three more bodies from a collapsed guesthouse at a megachurch in Nigeria's financial capital Lagos, raising the death toll to 45, emergency services said on Monday.

item.title: Two British tourists found dead on Thai island of Koh Tao
item.description: The naked bodies of two British tourists were found beaten to death on a Thai beach Monday, police said, sparking a murder hunt on the popular resort island of Koh Tao.

item.title: France, Iraq urge quick action against ISIS
item.description: "The fight of the Iraqis against terrorism is our fight as well," Hollande told representatives from around 30 countries and organisations, urging "clear, loyal and strong" global support for Iraq.

item.title: Beckham on Scottish independence: Save union that is world's envy
item.description: In a last ditch attempt to preserve the United Kingdom, Olympic ambassador David Beckham has weighed in on the Scottish independence debate.

item.title: Imran Khan booked for 'forcing' police
item.description: Khan has not been arrested in any case so far but police plan to move against him once the protests are over.

item.title: Egyptian blogger Alaa Abdel-Fattah released on bail
item.description: Egypt's most prominent activist blogger Alaa Abdel-Fattah, who is standing retrial after being sentenced to 15 years in prison for violating to the country's draconian protest law, has been released on bail.

item.title: White House still seeking coalition in Mideast war
item.description: For the last week, Kerry has travelled across the Mideast, to Turkey and finally Paris, to pin down nations on what kind of support they will give to a global coalition.

item.title: A to Z of Scottish independence referendum
item.description: As Scots prepare to vote for or against independence on Thursday, here is an A to Z of the referendum, including some of the key issues at stake.

item.title: Hillary Clinton in Iowa stirs 2016 speculation
item.description: Hillary Rodham Clinton has returned to Iowa for the first time since her 2008 presidential campaign, telling Democrats that voters face a choice between "the guardians of gridlock" and those who push for shared opportunity and prosperity.

item.title: Pak cops up ante, raid Imran's ally Qadir
item.description: Pakistani police had arrested several protesters and a court on Saturday ordered that 100 opposition activists be sent to jail on a 14-day remand for holding illegal protests and for other violations.

item.title: Arab states mull air strikes on ISIS
item.description: Several Arab countries have offered to carry out airstrikes against militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, senior US state department officials said on Sunday.

item.title: Swedish prime minister resigns after election loss
item.description: Swedish Prime Minister Fredrik Reinfeldt says he will resign after his center-right coalition lost a parliamentary election to a left-leaning opposition led by the Social Democrats.

item.title: Pope Francis breaks taboo by marrying couples who lived 'in sin'
item.description: A single mother, people who have been married before and couples who have been living together "in sin" were married by Pope Francis in a taboo-challenging ceremony at the Vatican on Sunday.

item.title: Liberia dismisses 10 officials for abandoning Ebola fight
item.description: Liberia's leader on Sunday said she had sacked 10 senior government officials who defied an order to return to the west African nation to lead the fight against the deadly Ebola outbreak.

item.title: For traumatized Iraqi refugees, 'psychological first aid'
item.description: Fourteen-year-old Yusra wipes away a tear before laying her head on the shoulder of aid worker Parzhin, after facing up to her fears and telling her story.

item.title: N Korea sentences US man to 6 years of hard labor
item.description: North Korea's Supreme Court on Sunday sentenced a 24-year-old American man to six years of hard labor for entering the country illegally and trying to commit espionage.

item.title: NKorea sentences US citizen to 6 years’ hard labour
item.description: Miller, from Bakersfield, California, and in his mid-20s, entered North Korea in April this year whereupon he tore up his tourist visa and demanded Pyongyang grant him asylum.

item.title: Australia contributing planes for anti-IS campaign
item.description: The 400 air force personnel and 200 others in the contingent could be deployed this week, PM Abbott told reporters in Darwin.

item.title: Khaleda Zia loses court battle on corruption charges
item.description: Earlier, the former prime minister had moved high court challenging the indictment but her plea was dismissed.

item.title: MH370 mystery: 58 ‘hard objects’ found in Indian Ocean
item.description: Six months after the jet disappeared in the Indian Ocean, aviation experts are still clueless over the world's greatest aviation mystery.

item.title: About 100 rescued from sunken Philippine ferry
item.description: Around 100 survivors have been rescued by two passing foreign ships and another ferry deployed for rescue operations by the company that owned the Maharlika.

item.title: Egypt's Sisi says coalition should go beyond IS
item.description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi told visiting US secretary of state John Kerry that any global coalition against terrorism should battle not just Islamic State but other groups as well, the presidency said on Saturday.

item.title: Pakistan protest talks deadlocked after arrests
item.description: Talks to end a month long sit-in by anti-government protesters in Pakistan were deadlocked Saturday after authorities arrested dozens of demonstrators, some of whom were accused of storming a TV station.

item.title: Ukraine PM slams Putin, ceasefire again under strain
item.description: Fighting flared near an airport in eastern Ukraine on Saturday in breach of a fragile eight-day ceasefire as the prime minister accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of planning to destroy his country.

item.title: 17 killed in Nigeria church building collapse: Rescuers
item.description: Seventeen people were killed when a building collapsed at the megachurch of one of Nigeria's most famous preachers and televangelists, the country's main rescue body said on Saturday.
